episode_event_academy_ch0352_ch0101_ch01: So yer goin’ to school even on Pasio, huh.
Yup.

I thought I could learn things I didn’t at
Blueberry Academy.
I see.

I’ve already told ya what I think is right
and wrong.
Now it’s up to you what ya wanna do with it.

Thanks, Daddy—for always letting me do what
I want!
Heh! Do what ya want, how ya want!
Just...
Hm?

Just come back to visit from time to time.
That’s all I ask.
Of course!

Once I make friends on Pasio, I’ll introduce them
to you!

And on top of that, all the classes at the academy
have been so fascinating!
Seems you’re having fun, Rosa.
Since you’ve such passion for learning...
why don’t you try teaching sometime?

By helping students understand your subject,
you can learn something new.
I see... I hadn’t thought of it that way!
But what could I teach?

Maybe I can talk about the time I battled
Team Plasma!
And I could act it out to make it more interesting.
That wouldn’t really be a class anymore, would it?
Well, I wanna do something unconventional!
There MUST be more ways to teach a class!
Yeah, you may be right.

I think I learned something new from you,
yet again!

Rei and Nate were flying around Pasio with their
Braviary...
Our Braviary were neck and neck!
Yeah! Your Braviary’s impressive, Rei!
Of course! He’s been with me since my Hisui days!
That’s awesome!

I’m amazed by your strength in battle and your
connection with your Pokémon!

You’re just as talented, Nate—and you’ve such a
strong bond with your Pokémon!

At least that’s what I thought when I battled you
at the Neo Champion Stadium.
Sure, but that’s a separate matter.
I’ve always admired you, Rei!

I’d love to hear more of your stories from Hisui
and the battles you had!
Of course! Ask me anything.

Let’s set up another time to chat and train
together!

I believe you can learn in more ways than just
sitting in a classroom!
I agree!
There’s so much to learn from other experiences.

As captains back in Alola, we’d stick totem stickers
all around the islands.
Stickers?

Yes! Really, if I had to describe them,
I’d say they’re stickers for helping trial-goers
on their island challenge.

If young trial-goers collected those stickers as they
traveled and followed the path they indicated...

they’d quite naturally progress along their
island challenge!
That’s so interesting!

I once designed a maze that requires the use of
Nosepass’s magnetism.
[Name:PlayerNickname ] helped me with it!

I wonder if students would enjoy learning at the
academy as well...
if we created more experience-based classes.
There must be a way!
Maybe we should brainstorm!

Yeah! We may be from different regions, but as
fellow Trainers’ School students...
let’s make the most of what we’ve learned so far!
